heading: amazon snags new cfo
subheading: the net retailer hires a former delta airlines executive to head its finance operations.
author: wired news report
text: amazon.com has hired a former airline executive as its new chief financial officer. on tuesday, the online retailer said that warren c. jenson, who had been executive vice president and cfo at delta air lines, would assume similar duties.see also: amazon logistics chief quits- - - - - -jenson is the second key executive appointment at amazon.com (amzn) in recent days. last week, jeffrey a. wilke was named vice president-general manager of operations. the hiring spree comes as amazon is in the midst of a massive expansion effort that includes construction of several new warehouses.jenson is a former cfo at nbc, and before that was staff executive and manager of mergers and acquisitions at general electric. he played a role in several nbc acquisitions and internet moves, and in the development and structuring of msnbc, amazon said.jenson succeeds amazon cfo joy covey, who is becoming the company's chief strategy officer.
